Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: We are given an event log with cases 2001 to 2005. We need to compute the total duration for each case from first event to last event and identify which cases are taking significantly longer. Then analyze how Resource Region Complexity correlate with longer durations. Lets compute durations Case 2001 First 2024-04-01 0900 Last 2024-04-01 1030 Duration 15 hours Case 2002 First 2024-04-01 0905 Last 2024-04-02 1100 Duration approx 2592 hours Case 2003 First 2024-04-01 0910 Last 2024-04-03 0930 Duration approx 4833 hours Case 2004 First 2024-04-01 0920 Last 2024-04-01 1045 Duration 142 hours Case 2005 First 2024-04-01 0925 Last 2024-04-04 1430 Duration approx 7708 hours Clearly cases 2002 2003 2005 are much longer than 2001 and 2004

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Now look at attributes Case 2001 Low complexity Region A Resources CSRJane AdjusterMike ManagerAnn FinanceAlan CSRJane Case 2002 Medium complexity Region B Resources CSRPaul AdjusterLisa ManagerAnn FinanceCarl CSRPaul Duration 26h Case 2003 High complexity Region A Resources CSRJane AdjusterMike ManagerBill FinanceAlan CSRJane Duration 48h Case 2004 Low complexity Region B Resources CSRMary AdjusterLisa ManagerAnn FinanceCarl CSRMary Duration 14h Case 2005 High complexity Region B Resources CSRPaul AdjusterLisa ManagerBill FinanceCarl CSRPaul Duration 77h

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Observations Low complexity cases 2001 2004 are fast regardless of region or resource Medium complexity 2002 is medium duration 26h with one request for additional documents High complexity 2003 A took 48h 2005 B took 77h Both have multiple requests for additional documents Number of requests correlates with duration

Name: Backtracking - PE
Text: 2003 had two Request Additional Documents events 2005 had three Request Additional Documents events For high complexity AdjusterMike in A had 2 requests AdjusterLisa in B had 3 requests

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: Region B might have longer duration for high complexity but confounded with adjuster Claims handled by AdjusterLisa region B for high complexity took longer and had more requests than by AdjusterMike region A Manager Bill for both high but different durations Finance not bottleneck CSR not main cause Bottleneck in evaluation and request phase

Name: Validation - PE
Text: We should also compute exact durations in hours for clarity Precise calculations confirm 2001 15 h 2002 2592 h 2003 4833 h 2004 142 h 2005 7708 h Clearly 2005 worst then 2003 then 2002

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Analysis Complexity High complexity leads to longer durations and more document requests Region For high complexity region A faster than B but more requests in B Resource AdjusterLisa region B handled medium and high with more requests Number of request events strong correlation

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - PE
Text: Explanations High complexity claims require multiple rounds of document collection Region B might have stricter compliance or less efficient processes Suggestions Implement pre-submission checklist Train adjusters Assign specialist adjusters Monitor KPIs Analyze time in each request step Improve communication with claimants
